text: I would be more inclined to attribute less deaths to us getting better at treating sick people, and having made a ton more ventilators.

elements.text: I would be more inclined to attribute less deaths to us getting better at treating sick people, and having made a ton more ventilators.

text: Doctors in the US have stopped using ventilators nearly so much as initially discussed. Instead, they just roll the patients on to their sides and in other ways try to help them to breathe.  I think more ventilators are helpful, but it's not a dominant factor.  I think your other comment "getting better at treating COVID patients" is a better answer

elements.text: Doctors in the US have stopped using ventilators nearly so much as initially discussed. Instead, they just roll the patients on to their sides and in other ways try to help them to breathe.  I think more ventilators are helpful, but it's not a dominant factor.  I think your other comment "getting better at treating COVID patients" is a better answer

text: And also having a whole lot more testing now..

elements.text: And also having a whole lot more testing now..
